reviewText:
The prequel to the film series Sharknado. Depth is set 10 months before the events of Sharknado take place as a team of contractor divers scour the seabed for the legendary treasure chest containing a spare copy of Sander's illusively secret KFC recipe. In the midst of it all, the Sharks own territory is trespassed by the fumbling and ignorant humans. Offended by this, Queen Jaws summons a frenzy of sharks to defend their territory before mankind's industrial machine reduces the seabed to nothing.

In under a week, an oil tanker suffers an accident at sea and loses over 2 billion dollars worth of oil. The marine life in the area perish and Queen Jaws becomes enraged with anger. Confident she can deter and ward off further human intervention, Queen Jaws assembles crack shark teams to rapidly intercept diver teams below the surface. Queen Jaws also orders random beach attacks at the many beach sites around the world as a means of spreading fear and terror.

Unfortunately for Queen Jaws, her plans begin to fail. More and more diver teams are successfully looting the seabed in search for the illusive Sander's secret recipe. Within a week prior of Sharknado, Queen Jaws assembles her remaining frenzy of sharks and rallies them at her designated staging base, just hundreds of metres under the freak hurricane that is about to destroy Los Angeles, and enact his final plan for vengeance against an ignorant and merciless foe...mankind.

If you're into sharks or scuba diving, this game is for you. Every Scuba Diver should pack this game into his waterproof laptop for those long working days thousands of meters under the ocean to kill some time. Great game with a simple learning curve. If you've been to Underwater World many times and your friends drag you along, drag this game along too! If you have a low budget, jump into your bath tub and fill it up and play with with laptop off to your side. Turn the lights off for even more realism!

reviewText:
Do you want payback on all those ignorant divers that go around playing cruel mind games, looking like injured seals? Do you want to pretend you are the scourge of Amity Island in the summer of 1975 - constantly being hunted by Richard Dreyfuss? Or do you simply want to live out your worst nightmare of being stalked by a great white shark in dark water? If you answered yes to one or more of those questions then good news! Depth is the game for you!

Become a nightmare of teeth and muscle and rip those dastardly surface creatures limb from limb, or become a group of recreational divers with an arsenal of automatic weapons and shoot an assortment of sharks in the face - the fun is endless.

Do you already have your credit card in your hand? Because you should!

reviewText:
Depth is a Multiplayer asymmetric PVP game, a fight to the death between Sharks and Divers. Each match is short, engaging, and surprisingly not repetitive. Within this game, the Divers will accompany there friend S.T.E.V.E the robot down into the ocean in search of the riches, only to disturb the very ocean the Sharks live in, who react (very) aggressively.

The PVP System is very fluid, the servers optimal, with 11+ maps spread over 3 game modes. In the base Blood and Gold Game, Divers go down into a wreck of a city or ship and attempt to find treasures and protect S.T.E.V.E whilst the Sharks try to hinder and kill the Divers. Each game starts with 2 Sharks against 4 Divers, each side having a shared 24 life pool. The game is terribly balanced, with an average life expectancy of a shark being one kill for one death, and as the game drags on, the Divers have the option of purchasing new gear, weapons and consumables in their fight against the Sharks. Meanwhile, the Sharks have the ability to upgrade their genetics, evolving and adapting to the scenario.

In terms of content, the player unlocks more and more weapons, upgrades for weapons and shark evolutions throughout playing, with each level up giving new options for the players. The common humor and comedy within the game adds to the chilled yet intense and thrilling atmosphere, and the only available In-Game Purchases are skins for sharks or weapons, making it entirely skill-based. There are currently 6 sharks available(each with its own active ability) and around 8 weapons available. The choice within the game of picking this weapon or this one depends entirely on the ability of the Sharks, which makes each weapon equal and useful in their own way, either dealing with pesky and fast sharks or a single shot high damage weapon for slower more tough sharks. The sharks themselves have expansive evolution trees, and could base their decisions off of the divers placing too many mines, or putting too many attachments to their weapons.

The game has a great skill learning curve, with Sharks being slightly harder to use than humans. The player base is pretty good, with an average of 10 seconds to 30 seconds if you are a diver and around 1 min to 2 min if you want to be a shark(At least, in my regions). In summary, this game is great, definitely buy it, and its humor, whether in the form of the speeches the captain makes, the updates to the game or its in-game chat potential make it a one-of-a-kind deathmatch arena.

reviewText:
I just finished telling someone this was a great Co-op Game and I just realized I didn't write a review on this yet.

Depth can be a great Co-op Game for 2 OR 4 players. One Team is two sharks checking out their local supermarket while the other team is four Divers plundering dat pirate booty all night long. Alternetive game modes exist, such as Hide and Seek, or Meglodon Hunt, where one player is a supermassive shark during Snack time.

If you have a group of 6 players, you can utilize match Making to find an empty server and all play together. I strongly recommend playing with VOIP over a 3rd party program like Team-Speak. Not only are the diver screams hilarious, but hearing your friends scream in abject terror as you carry them out to sea with a toothy hug is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ priceless.

reviewText: Simply put, this game is fun, if it is on sale I say jump on it. reviewText: Depth allows the player to experience the realm of underwater exploration and combat.  Players can choose to play as:  Sharks or Divers.  The sharks have multiple classes that allow the players define their combat style. The diver classes have many different types of weapons to choose from.  Flee from sharks as you try and collect treasure to upgrade weapons in Megalodon" mode.  There are different game types when it comes to playing with others.  Divers can escape sharks by stabbing them in the nose with a scuba knife.  Sharks are able to freely move through the environment and can break through weak structures to get within striking range of scrambling divers.  If you enjoy the ocean or sharks or playing games that involve going underwater and exploring environments then this game "DEPTH" is a must have."

reviewText:
played this game during the free day play and have to say it was quite good. I kept jumping into a game back to back without stopping. Do you love games where you can jump in and out with matches lasting from 10min-15min? Have you always wanted to fight intelligent sharks with harpoon rifles, spear pistols, and underwater smgs? This game's got it.

As divers in the Blood & Gold game you are tasked with escorting steve to three safeboxes and guarding him while he opens them. You can collect loose treasure littering the hallways of cargo ships and the ocean floor, the more you collect, the more you earn. The more you earn, the more upgrades you can purchase for your weapons which can make quick work of the shark (tracking upgrades are so helpful).

Sharks in this game mode must either destroy s.t.e.v.e. or exhaust all of the divers of their respawn tickets. The more kills a shark racks up the more evolution" traits they can earn. Such as increased stamina
recommended:
and better sonar.

It's fun to play these matches as they set up and conclude very quickly. However the hitboxes for divers is huge. I remember multiple times clearly dodging sharks and dashing into an opening only to be rubberbanded into a sharks mouth. Another issue is the respawn points. Sometimes the game will throw you infront of a shark with no time to get your bearings. I believe this is because the game will spawn you next to S.T.E.V.E.


Try the game out

reviewText:
You gonna need a bigger boat !

-Quick Description
Depth is game where you play as Shark or Diver.
Divers collects gold and follow robot NPC called S.T.E.V.E which goes around the map and opens treasure chests.
Sharks main goal is to kill divers and crush to the robot NPC which slows him.
Every team has a limited number of lives and both team can upgrade through the game by collecting gold or by killing enemy.

- Features and Pros
9 maps and 3 gamemodes (There will be more Maps and Mods through the frequent updates).
Lots of Diver Weapons featuring gadgets and special upgrades for weapons.
Sharks on the other side have Evolution points that you will get after killing a enemy Diver which you can then spend on Evolution perks which gave you more Armor or Detection,Etc.
Great Graphical Design with great Atmosphere (You will get adrenaline rush a lot)
UI menu looks great and lots of Graphical and other options to mess with.
FOV Slider !
Progression system (Level System) lots of things you can unlock.
SDK Editor (you can create your own mods for the game and then you have a chance that they will be add to the game)

-Cons
Bots (Computer AI) are ♥♥♥♥ing hardcore to kill (Recommended multiplayer only).
Divers can really camp the game sometimes and sharks can sometimes raid the spawn points and kill divers right after spawning.

-Conclusion
Buy this game !
Its really fun to play and gives you the adrenaline feeling you dont get on many games.
+ the developers are not ♥♥♥♥♥ they update the game with user made content and fixes a lot of bugs.

8.5/10
You gonna need a Bigger Boat !

reviewText:
For $25, this game gives you alot. Like, by alot, I mean alot.

Let's start by reviewing 3 things.

1. The Gameplay
The gameplay is mostly divers and sharks swimming around trying to either get treasure under the sea and getting mauled in the process. Very fun to play with friends + you can upgrade your weapons.
There are 3 basic modes in the game.
Megalodon Hunt
Blood and Gold
and one other game-mode I forget

The two modes are both equally entertaining as well as the other one I'm assuming. Also the feeling of getting hunted by sharks is both terrifying and exciting.

2. The Visuals
The graphics in this game are very pretty, and beautiful. Shiny sheens and different water colors + good rust on ships and things under the sea are very nice and come together to make a very good atmosphere. Everything in this game is beautiful.

reviewText:
This game wasn't what I expected, but in a good way.

I wouldn't exactly label this as a horror game—it's much more suspense-based than horror.  As the divers, things become tense when you start hearing the heartbeats that indicate that a shark is nearby.  You have to juggle your base instinct to survive with the greed to collect the golden treasures littered along the watery depths.

And the sharks are just as exciting.  By the nature of how the game is played, you'll always be outnumbered, but each shark has its own distinct trait that makes them dangerous, whether that means they're quick and stealthy, having the ability to turn the walls into death traps, or just overall being beefy and taking whatever hits the divers throw at them.

Game tend to be fairly quick-paced.  With friends, it's extremely entertaining.  I have to admit that there are certain sharks that, once divers reach a certain point with their weapons, become ineffective at stopping the treasure hunters.   But overall, I'm pleasantly surprised with this purchase and look forward diving into it (hohoho) for some time.

reviewText:
I gotta say, my first impression of this game is this; Well organized and properly executed.

Don't want to play a diver? You have the option of CHOOSING to play a SHARK without fear of being AUTO BALANCED on your team. Not up for being a shark? Same thing. You have the options of choosing a specific class to play or random, no matter your mood. This I enjoy greatly. It's nice to play a pvp with options and lack of some ♥♥♥♥♥♥ auto-balance JUST WHEN YOU START TO GET INTO A CLASS YOU ENJOY. and I'm pretty sure anyone who has played some other animals vs people pvp game can empathize. >_>

Now, onto the points.

Fantastic soundtrack, good quality with eerie undertones that make you on edge. Sounds are so important to this game, for shark and diver alike. What's around the corner? Friend or foe? Murky water and can't hear something coming up? Better listen for it, because that's your only hint.

The game controls are fairly simple, easy to learn but difficult to master depending on your reaction time. Once you get good at this game though, you get /good/. There are a ton of fantastic players out there too!

Models are top notch and the animations blew me out of the water(Pun intended). The shark's scarred detail wiggle my inner 3D modeler, there's so much detail, even down to the floating" jaw in the skull. Fantastic. The enviornment is one I wish I could kick back and explore in single player or with a friend

reviewText: First time I played this game it put me in the flippers of the diver.. my first options at buying weapons and such were quite limited so I got a handgun... Match starts and me and 3 other people I dont know follow STEVE and start collecting the loot. I glance around nervously yet see nothing. I get distracted by a shiney goblet on the floor I pick it up.. I turn around and see 2 of my buddies spinning lifelessly arms missing and what not.. I get nervous and try to see where this shark is.. I spot him and start shooting. by some miracle I kill him, I gloat and am severely pleased by my accomplisment.. second later I am dead.. I forgot about his friend..\n\none of the more exciting games I have played.. if you like that feeling of Adrenaline and excitment, anticipation and even the frustration of being mauled to bits now and then definetly go for this game.. its well balanced and servers are good

reviewText: Fun to play as divers and sharks, usually takes longer to join a game as a shark though. Can be frustrating playing with random players, works best with friends that have microphones. The games seems balanced enough to be fun and is spooky enough (as divers) that you don't care about score, it is mostly just screams and laughter. As the sharks you get a chance to try and outsmart the diver's defences. As the divers you try to buy devices that are most effective against the types of sharks on the other team. Mechanics are good too, I was worried about that because not a lot of games do a good job with underwater (furthermore animals and beasts), but its smooth and doesn't take long to get used to.

reviewText:
Depth is an amazing game. Play as a Diver and escort a robot called S.T.E.V.E or play as a Shark and eat all the Divers. There is many different weapons for the Divers and evolutions for the Sharks.

Pros:
- Fun Game
- Lots of diversity in hoe you can play
- Good Tutorial
- Atmospheric Map
- Gameplay is fantastic

Cons:
- Low Playerbase (It should be harder because this is a great game)
- No Matchmaking (Due to the small Playerbase)

reviewText: To watch the progress of this game has been a great pleasure for me so far. Devs have added so much content over the past year, and everything that is non-cosmetic has been free so far, which is something that's rare today, especially considering that this is not a full-price game.\nThe game itself plays pretty nice, the graphics are nothing special but not bad either. Different weapons with different improvements allow for a great range of possibilities as a diver, and shark evolutions do the same for sharks. Teamwork is crucial, so I recommend buying a four-pack of this game for you and your friends.

reviewText:
Pretty Darn Awesome Game, Fun with friends and solo (community isnt too bad either), Had some issues with map deisgn however, Some maps are incredibly biased and make sharks have a very very difficult time, due to camping spots with few alternatives other than running in hoping to kill something, only to die to the buffed mines.

The game itself is pretty good though with a well balanced upgrade and weapon system, smooth animations and very well developed art/effects this is a good buy for casual and hardcore gamers alike. Look forward a great deal to seeing how it evolves and what the Devs. add to it.

Good points:
-Beautiful enviroments
-fully 3D underwater, allowing movements and attacks in any direction
-Detailed character models and weapons
-Balanced upgrade/weapon system
-Good objectives with artifact retrieval
-Destructable Enviroment
-Fish give health

Bad Points:

-Some maps are heavily biased in Diver favour, and vice versa in a completely unbalanced way (may include not enough destructable walls, making it too easy to make an invicible camping spot
-Fish give such a miniscule amount of health that you may as well just kamikaze after a successful attack
-Very little alternate play content for sharks, as they are forced to try and kill divers (Would be nice to see Sharks being able to herd shoals of Jelly fish ect. towards divers as additional hazards).


*Notes for devs*
-(Would be nice to see Sharks being able to herd shoals of Jelly fish ect. towards divers as additional hazards).
-(Improved enviromental effects, such as crosscurrents would be an awesome game modifier)
-(Having larger team games available with multiple robots and pairs of sharks would also be cool)
-You have excellent communication with your fan base (This gives me many happy faces)

Reccomendation on this game:

Worth buying....Twice

reviewText:
After a few hours of playing, this is one of the best asymmetrical multiplayer games I have played in a long time.
Playing as a diver is a lot of fun, it's dark, and you're constantly in high alert, teamwork is key, and if you go wandering off you're probably going to get picked up by a shark.
Playing as a shark is a  lot of fun too, setting up ambushes as the divers are moving with S.T.E.V.E and destroying walls to get to them, be on the lookout for mines though.

I intend to play a lot more of Depth, and I think more people need to find this game, it's just awesome, and it's really well balanced, the sharks are not overpowered and the divers do have a real chance of  winning.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: After about four hours and 20 matches of gameplay i can say that the shark is my favorite. If you can get a game where the other sharkknows what he is doing then it is the easiest game to beat, however if the divers have an ace then they can be the ones who give you a stuggle. I also think that this game is meant to be one you play with friends to get those reactions of, them being the last one while steve is trudging along, then BAM shark comes along and kills them. One thing i would like to see changed is the point and progression system. I have noticed that as he shark you do not get nearly enough points in agood game as the divers do. Also the progression system seems to slow down to a crawl at around level four or five. All in all though this game is great and i hope even more people get it (So it doesnt take me five minutes to get into a match).

reviewText:
Afraid of sharks? DOESN'T MATTER! Depth is delightfully challenging and yet perfectly ballanced game!
Few games can hit that mark so perfectly. I picked Depth up on a whim and I'm glad I did!


PROs

1) Easy to pick up.
This game is simple enough to understand within your first time playing, and deep enough to give the player room to grow. Both SHARK and DIVER teams have a unique play style. Sharks being aggresive and fast paced and Divers being focused on defence and survival. The controles are easy to understand for new players looking to play on either team.

2) Competitive and Casual play
Play against players OR 4 different difficulty Levels of bots. Hard, Medium, Easy, or even Passive (If you just want to explore the maps) Players are always a mixed bag of difficulty, without being broken or over-powered. The Game's AI goes from being a walk in the park, up to an absolute challenging blood bath.

3) Play with friends
Fun to play with, or against friends. Very few game crashes/Lag outs within me and my friend's experiance.

4) Loadouts
Divers can buy a veriety of weapons and tools at the match progresses. Making shopping a bit fun. Your loadout can be Min/Maxed or Set up for multi-role without feeling weak. Sharks have Evolutions" as opposed to gear
date:
which improves the sharks preformance in and out of combat. Making them move faster and all around become more deadly.

5) Fun
Enjoyable! Plane and simple. If you like L4D especially you will love this game.



CONs

1) The AI
This is one of thise games where the AI doesn't get smarter with Level
recommended: but rather cheaper. Player Sharks for example
hoursPlayed: might miss every once in a while when they lunge at a diver. AI Sharks at medium and higher levels always make a perfect B line to the players within reach. Perfectly weaving around the enviorment to get to them. Its not bad enough to be unfair... but you will find yourself cursing at the AI every now and again. In addition
voteText:
AI Sharks may use the same predictable paths over and over at some sections of the maps. Making it almost too easy to fight them at these points. AI Divers are either too smart or too dumb. Sometimes swimming off all alone resulting in them getting ripped apart by sharks. Other times the diver AI will lock on to the sharks with pin point accuracy and almost never miss a shot.

2) Lack of content.
5 maps and 1 game mode. You will have fun with what little there is... but there still isn't much. Maybe in future patches or DLC there will be more.

3) Friend heavy game.
There is nothing wrong with playing alone
helpfulPercent:
but this game was obviously ment for friends. If you dont have friends who also play depth you may not have as much fun. I feel like playing alone takes away from over all the experiance.




In the end I would strongly recommend this game. Get some friends together and enjoy!"

reviewText:
Depth is by far the most reefreshing FPS experience in a long time! Provided you play with 5 other friends, it can be a blast and often a way to test your relationships. As usual, TL;DR is at the bottom, go on! You know you want too....

What is Depth?

Depth is an assymetrical team deathmatch consisting of 2 players as sharks, who play in the 3rd-person perspective, while there are 4 divers playing in first person. Divers have to follow an automated robot, S.T.E.V.E, in the hunt for undersea gold. While sharks have to stop them, at any cost!

Variety:

Divers have mutiple weapons at their disposable ranging from dual weild pistols to a net gun! Divers also have a variety of consumables" consisting of mainly flares to help navigate the murky DEPTH! haha
recommended: and mines.\n\nSharks' variety come in the form of different species of shark
hoursPlayed: including a megaladon. Yes. A freaking megaladon
voteText:
granted in Megaladon Hunt it's 5 divers versus 1 freaking megaladon.

Gameplay:

Gameplay is tense and varies in speed
helpfulPercent: games can be fast paced if well cooridinated or sharks can build tension by stalking in the shadows
votesHelpful: wither way gameplay is smooth and fun! Depth works with a levelling system
votesTotal: at the end of a match you gain experience which can be used to unlock new abilities for sharks (such as increasing stamina). This is useful considering sharks have two skill traits which differentiate them: stamina and health. The ability to upgrade this helps tighten the gap between the fast

the pinnacle of PC mastery.

Worth the buy?

It is indeed! The catch is that it's most fun with your buddies

but i never failed to have fun on a public server or even against AI in offline mode. At the time of writing (07/01/2015) Depth is $14.99 - worth picking up the four pack.

TL;DR:

Depth pits humans vs sharks

reviewText: I have a serious ♥♥♥ biting fetish, so Depth scratches that itch perfectly for me; in a way no one has yet been able, in fact. I will recommend this game, but I do have two issues I want to adress: First- The game is too difficult to play with just one hand. My other hand is clearly busy with the important details, so I would like a simpler, more wank friendly control scheme. Lastly- I hear a lot of people talking about having shark dreams after playing this game extensively; I myself am having that issue. Ever since getting Depth, my dreams have been wetter than the Oceans it's played in.\n\nI give this game::: 4 Carlos Butts, 2 Harpoons, a Mine, a Mako, and a Bang Stick as my official rating.

reviewText:
There's a certain point in any games developement where the best players are the worst to come accross.

I understand the intention of a challenge, but, when a challenge becomes impossible and playing a game seems to be pointless, the entire aspect of keeping it installed and maybe once a month saying: 'hey, maybe those people won't be on here and maybe I can have a nice game.' seems utterly pointless and almost sickening.

I recommend this game because it shows you that the world is a hard place to live. You have the people who play games to have fun, and those who play to just be jerks. It's a lesson on how life can throw you curve balls. And once a curve ball is thrown, the rest of the balls thrown are curve balls. ceaseless and never ending curve balls.

I mostly wrote this review to actually warn people that, in all honesty; be prepared to constantly die and rage quit. Those who have positioned themselved on the pinnacle of this leaderboard haven't given the game up. they continue to play and continue to make the game irritating and so much of a challenge, that, the challenge is to find another game that doesn't enduce rage.

So, yes, I recommend this game to those who are suicidal. This is as close to hell as one may get.

reviewText:
Pretty Darn Awesome Game, Fun with friends and solo (community isnt too bad either), Had some issues with map deisgn however, Some maps are incredibly biased and make sharks have a very very difficult time, due to camping spots with few alternatives other than running in hoping to kill something, only to die to the buffed mines.

The game itself is pretty good though with a well balanced upgrade and weapon system, smooth animations and very well developed art/effects this is a good buy for casual and hardcore gamers alike. Look forward a great deal to seeing how it evolves and what the Devs. add to it.

Good points:
-Beautiful enviroments
-fully 3D underwater, allowing movements and attacks in any direction
-Detailed character models and weapons
-Balanced upgrade/weapon system
-Good objectives with artifact retrieval
-Destructable Enviroment
-Fish give health

Bad Points:

-Some maps are heavily biased in Diver favour, and vice versa in a completely unbalanced way (may include not enough destructable walls, making it too easy to make an invicible camping spot
-Fish give such a miniscule amount of health that you may as well just kamikaze after a successful attack
-Very little alternate play content for sharks, as they are forced to try and kill divers (Would be nice to see Sharks being able to herd shoals of Jelly fish ect. towards divers as additional hazards).


*Notes for devs*
-(Would be nice to see Sharks being able to herd shoals of Jelly fish ect. towards divers as additional hazards).
-(Improved enviromental effects, such as crosscurrents would be an awesome game modifier)
-(Having larger team games available with multiple robots and pairs of sharks would also be cool)
-You have excellent communication with your fan base (This gives me many happy faces)

Reccomendation on this game:

Worth buying....Twice

reviewText:
After a few hours of playing, this is one of the best asymmetrical multiplayer games I have played in a long time.
Playing as a diver is a lot of fun, it's dark, and you're constantly in high alert, teamwork is key, and if you go wandering off you're probably going to get picked up by a shark.
Playing as a shark is a  lot of fun too, setting up ambushes as the divers are moving with S.T.E.V.E and destroying walls to get to them, be on the lookout for mines though.

I intend to play a lot more of Depth, and I think more people need to find this game, it's just awesome, and it's really well balanced, the sharks are not overpowered and the divers do have a real chance of  winning.

reviewText: After about four hours and 20 matches of gameplay i can say that the shark is my favorite. If you can get a game where the other sharkknows what he is doing then it is the easiest game to beat, however if the divers have an ace then they can be the ones who give you a stuggle. I also think that this game is meant to be one you play with friends to get those reactions of, them being the last one while steve is trudging along, then BAM shark comes along and kills them. One thing i would like to see changed is the point and progression system. I have noticed that as he shark you do not get nearly enough points in agood game as the divers do. Also the progression system seems to slow down to a crawl at around level four or five. All in all though this game is great and i hope even more people get it (So it doesnt take me five minutes to get into a match).

reviewText:
Having the server issue fixed almost immediately, I must say this is one of the best asymmetrical deathmatch games I've ever played.

Pros:
+ The game doesn't favour any of the 2 sides
+ The dev team looks very dedicated almost instantly fixing the server problem
+ Game itself looks great
+ You get the option to play as any role you want be it having lots of firepower, equipment that helps with collecting treasure or support gear like nets and tracker ammo
+ The progression system makes it so that the game doesn't get repetitive
+ Disconnected people get replaced by a competent AI on both the diver and the shark side

Cons:
- Time between a match end and being able to search for a match again due to the option being grayed out for a short time is pretty annoying, although I'm not sure this is intended or not
- Some clunky movement now and then when trying to fit through a gap as a shark making you an easy target

reviewText:
I really like Depth because it's very original and refreshing compared to most other competitive multiplayer FPS games out there. I love the theme of scuba divers looking for treasure while fighting off territorial sharks, despite it not being very realistic. The atmosphere is great too. Even though the game or the sharks aren't scary per say, there is just something about being in the ocean that's very unsettling. I haven't gone scuba diving in real life so I can't say how accurate the under water effects really are, but they all seem good and immersive to me. I really like how there are lots of schools of fish or an eel or octopus here and there. One thing I'm sure of that wouldn't be the case in real life is that I can hear a shark swimming towards me when I can't even see it yet, which makes it very easy to sound♥♥♥♥♥ them and quite unfair if you have a good weapon. If you know where one is coming from, you can just unload on it and the dash to the side when it is about to strike at you. I also just love the freedom of movement by being underwater.

The game pacing is interesting, too. It can be so calm and slow when the sharks are swimming outside the room you're in because they're scanning the environment or waiting for some diver equipment to be gone while you know they're very close because your heartbeat gets louder the closer they are, and then when they strike it's like all hell breaks loose and you're twitch-aiming because the sharks are fast and your diver can be fast too when dashing, or you get grabbed by one and you're mashing your left mouse button to stab it and try to get it killed before you're dead yourself. It can get very intense in a way that I haven't experienced in any other multiplayer shooter aside from the arena FPS games from the late 90s and early 2000s.

As the divers collect money, they can use it to buy new weapons ranging from pistols to assault rifles to harpoon guns, or upgrades for weapons they already have, resulting in these weapons becoming dual wield or having tracking or poison on the shots, as well as all sorts of equipment such as sonar bouys to detect sharks, mines and turrets as extra defense and offense, or supply and healing kits so you and your teammates don't have to swim out in the open to get ammo or a first aid kit. Sharks have a different type of currency, for they get evolution points by getting kills to be able to purchase evolutions making them a lot more durable or faster, being able to detect mines, seeing what weapons the divers are holding or regenerating health after getting a kill. This is a bit more unfair than the gold where all divers get the gold that one diver collects, because if you have a really good shark teammate getting all the kills, you won't be able to upgrade your shark at all. You'll most likely still win because of the good teammate, but it's a lot more fun to become an alpha predator yourself.

It does have some balancing issues. It seems that severe lag for the sharks often works out in their favour and I've noticed a lot of active people quitting because the game is becoming more and more casual with each weapon and equipment that gets added, but I just can't help having a blast when playing this. There also isn't any penalty to losing because you get experience points based on your own performance, not winning or losing, and there is only a stat that says how many games you played, not a win/lose ratio. It might not be suitable for a highly competitive environment with these arguable balancing issues, but I also haven't found a better game to scratch my itch for underwater shark-wrecking and diver devouring carnage. Whenever a new gamemode, playable shark or diver weapons and gear get added, which have all been free up to this point, I return to this game and enjoy it every single time.

reviewText: Solid brainless fun but with steep curve for survival as rookie's will struggle against veteran and seasoned players here. When you get the hang of it it starts to get even more rewarding and fun so do not lose your rags even if you get mauled a bazillion times at first. This one has pretty decent and atmospheric maps and overall visuals too so I would compare it to UT3 underwater with gore, sharks, and treasure hunt. The overall feeling I get is the same frantic brainless simple multiplayer action mechanics that made me love the UT since 3 to 4 so much. You don't have to be a rocket scientist to play this and sometimes that's great when all you do is want a little of braindead fun which you can get in and leave when done just like that. This is the best 'Jaws' game I ever played before and very entertaining in a similar fashion as left4dead and UT3 was.

reviewText: Possibly the best 10 dollars I've spent on steam. This game has given me more bang for the buck than most AAA 60 dollar titles I have purchased. I think I found this game in my que. While the video on the store page is good, what sold me on the game is a collection of videos by a you tuber named Ohmwrecker. These videos gave me a very clear picture of what the game play was like as a diver and a shark, and he and his friends sounded like they were having a blast. This game usually sells for around 25 dollars, and while I can't recommend it to everyone for that price,  Digital Confectioners have put this game on sale twice since I've purchased it for under 10 dollars. I think anyone who is even remotely interested in what they see in game play videos owe it to themselves to pick this game up. This game does have an intimidating learning curve. As a diver if you are well versed at shooters you will be up to speed in no time. If you aren't, don't sweat it, that is what machine guns are for. I am not the best player, so I steer clear of the spear guns. Also there are ways to play to support your team even if you aren't netting high damage per game. I don't know what to compare playing a shark too, but I love it. There are many very informative guides on steam written by players who have the taken the time to lay the basics and more out to help ease you into the game, I can't recommend enough you read them. I personally figured out diving myself, but was very intimidated by playing as a shark, and used a guide until I got my feet under me. There are always people playing so you don't have to worry about dead servers. The small size of the community is a blessing and a curse. Players are mostly friendly and helpful, and you will run into the same players often. At the same time you will often get matched up with players who far out level you. All said and done I love this game and if it wasn't for bloodborne this would be my game of the year 2015!

reviewText:
The Steam summer sale finally convinced me to buy the game.  I have wanted it for quite a while, I love the PvP concept with different species.  I was blown away with how good it is.  My time with it has been very well spent.  This game is INTENSE!  This is what I wanted from Evolve, which was disappointing.  Does Depth still have some rough edges? Yes.  Does it matter when you're playing? NOT ONE BIT!  :D

Playing as a diver is stressful, in a good way.  They've done a great job on the atmosphere and feeling of it.  Hearing your heartbeat speed up is a great indicator of the increased danger, I love it.  It's never a completely one-sided battle, sharks are fast, divers have tech.  Currently no difference in each diver that I can see, it's all about your load-out.

The sharks all have different strength and weaknesses.  Playing as a shark is fantastic, really gives you that hunting" feel.  Find a shark you're good at and stick with it

reviewText:
Indie Game + Free updates and upgrades without extra cost + no cash grab + comptetive and balanced play + only Cosmetic DLCs are paid =

%100 recommended, my all time favourite animal was/is/will be sharks and in this game i can feel like playing one brutal shark!

4 divers vs 2 Sharks, it might sound weird but it has team work and it is exciting like spy vs merc in splinter cell games. and it is something like payday, you need to pretect a robot called STEVE (AI) which is digging treasures in 3 steps and then escort it safely to the boat and sharks have to kill the divers until their spawn point is 0 or they can damage the STEVE and delay the process or even destroy it.

reviewText:
This game has huge potential for tension – but it isn't using it yet. Instead of weaponry and competition, I really think the focus should be in horror.

The game's pace is very fast. So fast, in fact, that you can't get immersed in the time you are already dead. (Think of fast CS rounds.) And respawning mere seconds after dying to the same position takes away your will to stay alive, so that too breaks immersion. If the gameplay was slower (and actually the diver swimming speed is itself too fast) there would be a chance to take notice of your environment, look around and build tension.

I think the game reveals too much; letting you know all the time where your squad mates are with glowing outlines. It would be a lot creepier if you were forced to communicate with them to understand your relative position, and I believe this would hugely benefit the game. There is sadly very little room for sneaking due to the fast pace, and strategizing seems to be out of question due to always being in a hurry to die in a few seconds.

Menus and HUDs are alright with no extra fancy things – I respect that. But I have to say that some game features are less intuitive. For example, the heart beat effect is striking, but I did not understand what causes it: is there a hidden fatigue meter? Hidden stress meter? Does it imply a close shark? I simply could not tell. And also some numbers jumping up in the screen with successful hits were confusing as there were so many that one could not tell what the numbers meant. One of them surely was the immediately damage I dealt, but the others? These need some clarification.

Right now it's a game of swimming immediately to a fixed location, killing the enemy, dying, buying a bigger gun, respawning again, then repeating this again. Heck, it might even make sense to die on purpose to get to buy things. All this takes the huge potential scare the game could have away. I'm hoping there will at least be more hardcore or scary experience -focused game modes if the main idea remains unchanged.

Would love to play this as a diver with a dying flashlight with Oculus. :)

reviewText:
It's a good game that gives me the sweats as a diver, and a bloodboner as a Shark. There was one fun bug I encountered where my diver swam into a small crack in the geometry and got stuck, paving myself in the walls Amontillado style. That bug was fixed the very next day. Here's hoping they continue with the good fixes and keep their promise for new maps and SDK.

My only problem is that you will gain an average of 150xp per match, and every level requires (to my knowledge) Level * 100 xp to progress to the next. You will need to reach level 23 to unlock every item, which is about 27,600 xp. Expect to run about 180 matches (if your having a gg, not a bg) before you can test everything. Some of these equips and abilities are amazing, which is why it's a little sad that you are at a slight disadvantage if you cannot use them, against someone who can select their own specialized unlocks, in a competitive game.

Edit: It appears that after level 10, the XP is capped at 1,000xp. So I guess there is a proverbial  diminishing returns light at the end of the shark cave.

reviewText: BEST GAME EVER! :D

reviewText:
About The Game:
Depth is created by Digital Confectioners an indie developer who felt it was a good idea to really spice things up with a game of Team Deathmatch against Sharks & Divers.

This game shares the great aspect of fast paced Survival Action & at the same time horror as you never know when a shark is going to rip you apart.

Gameplay:
Depth is a game based on fast paced decision making & shooting, this game punishes you for not thinking quickly and acting even faster.

This game focuses on a Team Deathmatch experience as well as objectives in small for the Divers to win you can either kill all the Sharks or you can watch out for your diving machine while it collects all the tresure and guide it back to your boat safely. As a Shark you have to simply stop the Divers from collecting all the tresure or by killing them all.

The game consists of 2 teams, 4 Divers VS. 2 Sharks. Each team relys on the other players to work together otherwise you'll waste more lives than you should if you're not working together and soon be out.

Each time has 30 lives in the beginning and you have to monitor your teams deaths as closely as possible as those lives run out fast.

Gameplay as the Diver is as expected, pretty slow & very vulnerable, you can be detected by a shark really easily and there's no way to heal yourself after you are attacked so this puts you in a tough spot if you're in a hurry or running low on lives.

Divers can use weapons such as Pistols, Assault Rifles, Netguns, Harpoons, Tagging Pistols & Rifles, etc there's a very large range of weapons at your disposal but each weapon needs to be unlocked by completeing missions and ranking up. Divers also have a range of placeable items such as Sea Mines & Motion Sensor Boeys in order to track or kill a Shark, you also have Flares which you can use to see into dark parts of the ocean bed if you wish.

Sharks rely on their instincts & teamwork in order to beat the Divers, you need to work with your partner to maximize you brutality and cunning, this can set the team in a panic and give you a chance to sneak off with one of the Divers in your jaws.

Sharks come with a wide variety of Abilities & Upgrades as the Divers do, you gain the ability to withstand more damage, regenerate health, feast on Divers blood to increase health &  stamina, gain a Hammer Head to smash through walls and roofs at an increased rate, resist tagging devices, spot Sea Mines and smell out Divers from a greater distance.

Sharks are really terrifying up close but at a distance they're in a danger zone, because the Diver weapons are fairly strong and do deal a lot of damage so don't think you can just rush in at the Divers without dying.

Single Player:
Depth has a Single Player mode that pits you against Bots to test your skills & learn how to play the game in a controlled and relaxed environment unless you switch the difficulty up that is. In Single Player you cannot unlock new weapons.

Multiplayer:
Depth also has a Multiplayer PvP where you and 5 other people can play together as Divers & Sharks it works as explained in the gameplay section above ^. In Multiplayer you can unlock equipment and upgrades as normal.

Co-operative:
Depth also has a CO-OP mode where you and 4 friends can play as Divers together and take on the bot Sharks or you and 2 Friends can play as Sharks and take on the 4 Bot Divers,  In CO-OP you can unlock upgrades & equipment as normal.

Verdict:
Depth is a very interesting idea for a game, it combines the fast paced gameplay of Call of Duty" into a much better game of cat and mouse while at the same time keeping things very well balanced out and never feeling underpowered against the enemies.

Depth has such solid gameplay and teamplay that makes it succeed at what it wanted to
date:
it leaves you feeling like a badass when you complete the game as a Diver against the Sharks because of your solid teamwork and coordination with your team and it makes you feel like a killing machine when you defeat the Divers as Sharks.

Even if you don't win you still feel accomplished at the end of the game because it's such a fantastic game.

There is however are a few things this game needs to fix:

Network lag when you play as the Divers really puts you at a disadvantaged when you are getting attacked from out of nowhere or when the Shark just magically teleports infront of you. Even in my home region i was getting lag.

The Spawning System in Depth needs some work
recommended:
i found myself spawning and dying a lot because of being spawned right infront of a Shark.

Rating:
And finally after coming down to it this game receives from my a solid 8/10
hoursPlayed: it's not perfect but it's certainly worth a the money you pay for it.\n\nIt brings something new to the table & does it well props to the developers for thinking outside the box
voteText:
it feels a lot like Zombie Panic! Source.

Do I Recommend This Game?:
Yes i do
helpfulPercent: pick this up whenever you've got a chance you won't regret it."

reviewText: Depth is a game that I was hoping to be good, luckily it was! Going into detail about what it is, Depth is a multiplayer game in which a team of 4 divers is pitted against 2 sharks. Lacking in an abundance of game modes in which I hope the devs will be adding more on later, Depth features a great selection of maps which are well-designed and look fantastic from the surface as well as in the ocean you're playing in. Atmosphere in this game is extremely heavy as while you're searching for treasure you hear your heartbeat get faster and faster until one of those two sharks approaches from the dark depths (lmao geddit xdddd) and rips your diver in two. Optimization in this game is also done fantastically as I've only experienced this game crashing on me only two times, other than that your frames in this game should be fine even if you meet the minimum recommended specs for this game. Overall I'd say buy this game either for full price or on sale, either way it's up to you just make sure you get a chance to experience this fantastic game!\n\nEDIT: Had experienced crashes, contacted support and told them what problems I was having, they had responded and patched the crash approximately a week later, kudos to these guys for giving a damn about their game unlike some other devs. Hoping to support these guys in whatever they decide to do next!

reviewText:
Greetings fellow gamers! This is Gamer Guy (In a Suit) from the Echo Army YouTube channel! Today I am bringing you a review of the Team-Based, Mulitplayer Action Gore-Fest known as Depth. Depth recently celebrated it's 1st birthday on Steam and has been around since November 3rd, 2014. It was released by Developer/Publisher Digital Confectioners.

(NOTE: This was a review from a game in my own Steam library, it was NOT provided by the Developer and/or Publisher)


Video Review:

https://youtu.be/e9BIjKTJPWE

The Too Long
date:
Didn't Watch" Review:

Great twist on the Team-Based Multiplayer experience. You can be a diver or a shark. What more can you ask for?
4.5/5
recommended:
Grab the 4-pack (especially when it's on sale)!


The "Meat & Potatoes" Review:

Many of my friends know I am not a big fan of this style of game. I did play BF3 for a while and enjoyed it
hoursPlayed: and I did the CoD streams with Echo
voteText: but Team-Based Multiplayer games like this were never much more than average fare (for me). This beast
helpfulPercent: though. Man. This is what Evlove SHOULD have been. One team is the Divers
votesHelpful: the other team is the Sharks. There are mutliple game modes
votesTotal: I spent most of my time in the Blood & Gold mode (divers collect treasure and defend themselves
votesFunny: sharks eat divers). You can earn money/evolution points and upgrade your weapons and items or abilities as a shark. Really
commentsCount: talking about a game like this is frankly a waste of time. It's something you have to play to enjoy. I typically am non-plussed by this style of game
column16: but this one really is TONS of fun and took me back to the golden days of MultiPlayer gaming with my friends on Goldeneye and the like. This is cheaper
column17: and better
column18: than Evolve. The $24.99 or so that you can buy a 4-pack for during a Steam sale is an absolute steal. The graphics are great
column19: the sounds add to the fun
column20: the controls are simple. Add in neat skins and stuff (cosmetics)
column21:
and it's a nice little game that seems to be picking up in community numbers. Give it a go and get in now while the community is growing. The Devs are active and the game still gets regular updates. This is the kind of game you cumulatively sink hundreds of hours to over time.

4.5/5 as it's still growing into that 5 that I am positive it will get to.

Happy Gaming!!!"

reviewText:
This game is a gud game, 8/8 I r8 m8

Good things -
- Intense gameplay as diver
- fun and sneakyhunty gameplay as shark
- maps are super pretty and well designed
- devloper are adding more content and they communicate with the community
- community is getting larger
- Lobby/main menu is well designed, it's kinda like dota 2's lobby
- graphics are above average for an indie game, animations are really good
- both 2v4 teams are balanced
- achievements are awesome
- Servers cover most of the world so unlikely to have high ping, including Australia, Europe and ofcourse US
- Never had problems with lag even on US servers (from australia)
- Very fun game

Negatives (I struggled to find any)
- Needs more shark types/skins added for variety for shark, devlopers said they are going to add this but have not done so yet.
- the heartbeat thing for divers could be turned down a little bit because the sound of it sometimes overpowers other sounds, but it does do it's job in making it more intense for drivers.
- They could add more content for sharks such as more hp recovery sources and new game modes, but more will be added in the future

This game is definitely worth the money and I would recommend this game to anyone, it's also a good subsitute for evolve if you don't want to pay the money for that, I've played both and they are equally as fun, but this also adds many other things to the table with the asymetrical enviroment, needing to be aware with all that's around you. Game needs more love in my opinion.

Thanks for reading my review!

reviewText:
Shark snorkelling simulator 2015.

Learn how to quickly and efficiently snorkel sharks and ward thyself from being ship-rekt.

Nothing is more satisfying than this, that and writing GG Shrimp or Harpwned upon killing a shark depending on thine chosen weapon.



OK ENOUGH WITH JOKES

This game is a great game that pits the human brain and cunning against an apex predator in their own habitat. It is very balanced, even though when you first play you'll probably think otherwise. It has a fairly high learning curve for the divers, sharks being much easier to pick up but not any more powerful than the divers.

If you want to succeed as a diver, make dang sure you have your settings set where your computer runs with at least 30-40fps. You will need this to reliably have enough time to dodge a shark's lunge.

THE MAIN THING YOU NEED TO SUCCEED AS A DIVER IS BALLS OF BRASS- the more you're afriad of the oversized guppies the more they'll turn you into mince meat. Do not be afraid. Sharks are just fish, if they give you trouble...just show them who's the boss.


Basic Summary (tl;dr for you illiterates out there)

PROS-

Every weapon is a real world thing

Well balanced, horrifying, and fun assymetrical multiplayer

Cabela's Dangerous Fishing

Active devs that continue to add new FREE content

You get to snorkel sharks

CONS-

High Learning Curve turning some away at the start, though this isnt necessarily a bad thing. Not the turnig away fo players, but the fact that you can become skillful at this game.

CPU intensive, you can play on a cruddy computer but you'll need low settings (I do this myself for FPS as I play on an HP Laptop)

This is not a good game for people with bad internet, it wont end well

Sharks can snorkel you.



Overall this game deserves a  9/10 in my opinion.

NOW GET OUT THERE AND SNORKEL SOME SHARKS

reviewText: Excellent game. Simple to learn and then great fun to master. Brilliant as both divers and sharks, a very intense atmosphere in beatiful locations. The maps are well designed and offer an amazing 3d environment to manouvre in. Excellent sound effects and I love the wildlife swimming around with you, jelly fish, seals, and even a very large octopus. Really adds to the feeling of being a long way from home deep down in the ocean. You can almost smell the sea air when it starts. Gameplay is so far well balanced, with it being close finishes a lot of the time. Not a lot of additional content (game modes, customisation etc) but it does seem to be growing. I have had a lot of fun so far with it, once you get the hang of it (there isn't much of a tutorial).

reviewText:
I absolutely love this game! My roomie kept trying to convince me to buy it so we could both play and it ended up with 6 of us buying the game. There a few things I would like to see added or touched up though!

Pros:

- Awesome co-op play
- Dark and terrifying atmosphere
- Decent amount of weapons to play with

Cons:

- Flares seem lackluster and don't illuminate much, perhaps I'm not using them correctly
- A few maps have a very large open-water section at the end of the map which I've found to be almost unfair for divers
- only 6 maps atm, 10 if you count the Megalodon game type, though I don't enjoy it as much.
- Not enough pairs of underwear


I would love to see a few more maps and gametypes come in later dlc/patchs, as well as game variants with more players.

reviewText: I was expecting a suspenseful survival horror with long matches and lots of panicking in murky, open waters. Instead, I got twitch shooting at highlighted shapes down dark corridors. The matches are relatively short and filled with tons of respawns, everything dies quickly and there's not much stalking or horror attached.\n\nHowever, I'm not complaining. I'm having a blast. The game is a very refreshing addition to the multiplayer arena shooter scene.

reviewText:
I have over 300 games on steam, around 60% unplayed.. I have a tendency to buy things and never touch them.. this isn't one of those items.

absolutely brilliant. on steam most games are simply variation shooters.. this game.. blown away. they managed to make it fun, and still a sense of progression etc.. there are a couple of tweaks needed as with any new title.. (number tweaks etc) I'd also like to be able to change shark type once the game has begun (unless im stupid I missed a key?)

but overall, amazing game. well worth its price tag. very fun. It's not going to replace your 'main' game etc, but its like L4D. It's one of those games that youll have and love, and every now and again, youll come to blow off steam and this will hit the spot!

brilliant.

reviewText: This game is awesome! To begin with, the game is just plain awesome! It's a mix between fps and horror, and best of all the developers are actually involved with the community and is active. They recently sent out an update adding new sharks, a gamemode, and maps. Trust me, you WILL get your money's worth. I trust that the developers will keep adding new things to make your experience nice and just plain awesome. Okay, so if your still not convinced, wait a while for a resonable sale, and if you are stuck between buying this game or another, BUY THIS GAME. I have logged some hours into it on my free time and have enjoyed every scare, loss, and win. I have only one more point to add, if you get scared while playing horror games, you can pick to be only a shark when finding a game instead of being a diver or either. I hope this helps someone and thanks for taking your time into reading this!\n\nP.S- you will need to boost your sensitivity before you play in the settings, it's really low at default settings and will make your game experience a bad one. (I made that mistake) :D

reviewText:
Play as one of 2 sharks or 4 divers as the divers race to collect all the gold, and the sharks try to stop them.

As a shark: Bust through walls, sneak through shipwrecks. Bolt from the dark and eat a diver, thrashing your mouse to tear his greedy flesh!

As a diver: Work together to stay alive and escort an unmanned submersible as it cuts into safes and gathers Nazi gold. Seriously. Work as a team or be chow. Always buy the consumables. And don't forget, when they're trying to eat you, you can still stab them with your dive knife! Don't go down without a fight!

SOoooo worth a play, but get it on sale.

reviewText:
Is Depth a great game?
I am trying to answer that question in that review
--------------------------

+ great Atmosphere
+ great gameplay
+ great graphics
+ a lot of variety
+ it runs good

--------------------------

- it takes a long time to get on a server
- the server are sometimes laggy

--------------------------

Depth is not only a good first person shooter. The visuals and the atmosphere make it way more than a simple first person shooter. The setting make it different from Different from other games out there even though the gameplay feels familiar to other games on the marked.
In the end Depth make a great mix between something really unique and something familiar.

=> 8.5/10

reviewText:
This game, right here, THIS ONE. buy it... BUY IT!!!
no seriously this game is hilarious wheter you play diver or shark.
as a diver your only clue that a shark is nearby is your heartbeat. gets faster the closer they are... then you turn around and only see a tail and you KNOW... he missed you by an inch. then all of a sudden youre halfway down his mouth stabbing him in the face trying not to be devoured.
as a shark you really have to play a predator game, attack the isolated ones, that last guy in the file trying to catch up to his buddies...
i would buy this game again anytime.
its like counter strike but with sharks, the divers are the evil terrorist trying to steal all the gold and you are the gentle shark trying to rescue those shiny bits of metal.
and do not think sharks have it easy. this game is awesome for its balance.
BUY IT AND SHRED THOSE DIVERS!!!!

reviewText:
Intense, gory and original. There is quite literally nothing like it on Steam right now. This multiplayer only, asymetrical shooter is the type of game that breathes life into the stale genre of FPS, where little innovation occurs due to the small number of big name franchises that dominate the market.

Pros:
- High intensity
- Smart gameplay
- Balanced
- Tactics required for success
- Great fun to be had for both teams, but in different ways
- Feels fresh

Cons:
- Small number of maps
- Bot games switch from too easy to too hard between easy and medium
- Price is a little high

Overall, I would definitely recommend this game, but would also recommend trying to get it cheaper than it's current price through deals/sales.

reviewText: In the vein of Left 4 Dead, comes a ravenous gnashing of serrated teeth into the depths. Before your very eyes, your friends will be eaten, their limbs torn from their torsos in a frenzy of blood and guts; their insides will taunt you, and the fish will laugh at your misfortune and demise. Dwell at the bottom of the ocean, wrenching in the harrowing dilemma of saving your companions, or keep up with the ever-roaming robot--hungry for the riches that lie below.\n\nThe game features a broad spectrum of gameplay, switching between shark and human, and it never fails to deliver a pulse-pounding ride as both predator and prey. Asymmetrical gameplay haunts the core of this apparition, and it never fails to disappoint. It's a well balanced game, surprisingly, and much to my delight. So, slip into those wetsuits, load your harpoons, and sharpen those teeth, because the fun never ends when you delve deep into these crimson waters.

reviewText:
So, Depth is about spooky sharks vs lunchboxes/divers.
Currently sporting two modes, both being quite tense, you have  the regular Escort mission, 4 divers vs 2 sharks, with a basic variation in sharks and weapons and equipent to use. The fun in this game comes from the tactics really, as a shark you really have to be careful, you die just as fast as the diver...but you ar MUCH faster ;) Wait for a diver to swim past a doorway then lunge through, turning the corner so that their friends can't shoot you, and chew them up :D

As a diver, you simply *have* to use the equipment to be effective. You won't see a good shark coming until it's almost on top of you, but with sonar and tagging systems, you can help relieve this drawback! :D

The second mode is Megladon Hunt, a team of divers against one Megladon, and the divers have to collect treasure to upgrade their guns!

Pros -
~ Very Spooky game, more atmospheric than you'd imagine
~ Hilarious fun
~ Good replayability
~ Rewarding for skilled players
~ Quite easy to find a match
~ UPGRADE SYSTEMS YAY
~ Pretty and interesting world

Cons -
~ Menus are kinda dated
~ Character models are a bit lax, but I assume that might get an update
~ Only 3 choices of shark, bit generic too. Was hoping for some cool things like having built in abilities for the sharks, for example a hammer head could ram better maybe?
~ No customization of character sadly (WE WANT HATS, WE WANT HATS, WE WANT HATS)
Seriously, every game needs microtransactions for cosmetics :D

All in all, while it's on sale I'd definitely pick it up, I think £18-19 is a bit too much but having paid £11, I'm damn happy with my purchase :D
8/10 Best diving game ever" - Davy Jones"

reviewText: Excellent game and more than worth the normal sales price. You get to play as either a shark or a diver. The objective of the divers is to work as a team of four to collect treasure from different settings on the sea floor with a robot safe picker called S.T.E.V.E. Divers move from one objective to the next on the map and have to escort S.T.E.V.E to each treasure safe until the team makes it back to the extraction point at which point the divers win. Divers are armed with different undersea weapons like harpoons, net guns, and undersea mines. The sharks come in teams of two and their goal is obviously to eat the divers before the sharks run out of lives or the diver team makes it back to the extraction point. The game requires some strategy without being too complicated; divers tend to stick together to back each other up and the sharks do best when coming up with surprise entrances to swoop in and grab a diver for dinner. Easy recommend, you won't be disappointed!

reviewText:
Created in the UDK engine, the same engine as gears of war and borderlands, you should already have a clear image as to what to anticipate in unique fps at first glance. The game does great job at submerging players into its wonderful underwater environment. Everything works, from, the ambient objects and creatures that make up your surroundings, the lighting decaying as you descend deeper into the threatening ocean and the heartbeat sounds as the shark draws closer and close.

My first impressions upon playing depth was that of a young kids learning to swim in the deep ocean,
I didn’t have any idea and was ♥♥♥♥ scared. After I realized It was ok to leave the cage, I started to swim around and collect the shiny treasure scattered on the sea floor, then I heard a heartbeat sound that was rapidly increasing I knew that the shark was getting closer, boom, all of a sudden I have this great white shark eating half my body, leaving me with wet patch of ♥♥♥♥ on my pants.

The gameplay was pretty smooth, a little lag from my system that made it hard to focus my gun on the shark before it eviscerated me. The movement was also smooth and found I could travel at a reasonable speed and evade the shark’s attacks.

Did I also mention you can play as a bloody shark!
Imagine stalking your friend and tearing your teeth into them as a great white shark.

Honestly, what more could you ask for, best shark game around, 100x better then call of duty and not to mention you will probably need spare set of pants for after you play this game.
Don’t believe, buy it.

reviewText:
Finally, an FPS that I'm actually decent at!

Depth is a Underwater Asymmetrical first person shooter, pitting four armed divers with two hungry sharks. This game is a mixture of intensity and quick shooting. Hearing the heartbeat (signal for divers that a shark is nearby) and frantically trying to find where the shark is before it gets you is one of the most engaging aspects of this game.

The game is surprisingly fair and balanced. Even though it's 4v2 (and in the new mode 5v1), the sharks don't feel underbalanced, nor are they OP. They're balanced basically as Glass Cannons, encouraging a hit and run style of gameplay. Being on the Diver team requires teamwork, since divers are easier to kill, and have a shorter vision range. Even though communication with teammates is next-to impossible, keeping an eye out for your teammates as a diver is encouraged, as to avoid losing too many respawns early on.

Would I say $25 is worth it? Maybe. I bought it 50% off, and I would encourage anyone to get it on sale, but the game is being updated and kept stable by the developers. While the gameplay could arguably become mundane over time, if the game is kept updated and fresh with new maps, sharks, and weapons, this could be a classic in the making.

At the very least, it's a damn good aesthetic.

reviewText:
First review ever, but I think this game is worth it.
I was hesitant to buy it for the full price due to reading that there aren't many players.
But right when the sale happened I grabbed it and I am glad I did.
I have only played as the diver.

Someone mentioned that it may seem hard to new players, but I disagree. Today(+1 day after sale day) I am the MVP in about 80-90% of the games I play. So either the other people are even newer than me, or it just isn't hard to pick up.

NB! It isn't unbalanced. Unless the divers go out exploring the map(which happens) or the sharks don't use the environment(destroy the walls!), it is very balanced. It is very often a close call.

Pros:
* Very beautiful and fluid" gameplay
* Huge open maps - although I don't suggest you to go explore them as a diver
* Fun weapons - you are happy for every connecting shot
* Fun gadgets(mines[FUN!]
recommended:
etc)
* You truly feel anxious in open waters
* Fun "combat system" - you get to stab the shark in the face if he grabs you
* Those cat and mouse dashes where the shark tries to catch you but you dart out of the way(makes your heart race)
* You get to kill a lot of sharks - expect at least 5+ on your first game(30 sharks total for 4 divers)
* Shortish matches - about 15-20 minutes I'd say. But they seem fast and I haven't had the time to look at the clock :D
* Constant intense gameplay - there are no 'slow moments'

Cons (very subjective):
* I think the menu system is clunky. For example I havent' found where I can see my unlocks outside of a match. I'd say it is very robust
hoursPlayed: but still lacking a bit.\n* The weapon upgrade system doesn't quite suit me. I don't know why
voteText: it's just bugging me. I'd prefer a tech-tree maybe.\n* It can get repetitive after about 5+  matches in sequence. A little down-time helps with that.\n* Could have more maps(currently 7
helpfulPercent: I'd like 15 at least). I know this is immense work
votesHelpful: but still.\n* Could have more weapons/gadgets - not that there aren't any
votesTotal: but I'd just like more :)\n* Gold retriveal part - that needs to be made a bit more interesting\n* There doesn't seem to be a way to "turn around" the battle
votesFunny: the probable winner(team) usually starts to become clear after the first few larger attacks.\n\nOverall
commentsCount: very glad I bought this and I hope the community sticks. 9/10"

reviewText:
I have to recommend this game.

Got that nagging feeling that in 10 years time i'll still be dropping into this submerged world.

In the game description it's described as heart pounding" and at times it really is.

Either crank the volume right up or (as i do) use your headphones and dive into (no pun intended) this atmospheric classic of a game.

So to give a brief outline
hoursPlayed: 15 minutes or so. You play either as a shark or diver and i have as much fun as either. Completely different tactics for each side.\nThe sharks are looking to make blistering attacks where they can whisk their prey away from their other
voteText: armed
helpfulPercent: divers.\nThe divers need to stick together
votesHelpful: preferably within areas which are well protected by the scenery. However
votesTotal: in order to get their upgrades
votesFunny: divers need to collect gold and deposit it back with STEVE
commentsCount: an underwater robot controlled from the surface. Steve breaks into safes
column16: and you have to protect him until he's done and back safely.\nSharks get upgrades too
column17: and earn 1 upgrade point for each diver killed. So there's the incentive
column18: if you needed one.\n\nBoth teams have a  limited amount of respawns
column19: so both divers and sharks have to pick their attacks carefully else they'll run out.\n\nAnd that's it - not a complicated game
column20:
but a lot of fun.

Negatives?
Every review needs to be balanced
column21:
but i will emphasise that the positives really outweigh the negatives for me.

After 10 hours i do feel a slight nagging repetitiveness of the maps creeping in. I hate myself for saying this as on only medium settings i do find the maps very well done. Would like so see more please.
On the subject of graphics
column22: i find my nvidea GTX 870M blasting away at full steam playing this whereas withother games i own
column24:
seem much better optimised. That's a very high level view though but people with lower performance cards might be struggling.
Perhaps the folks at http://www.shiningrocksoftware.com/ can teach them a thing or two - probably the best optimised game i've ever played given the old crappy system i used to play Banished on. Check his blog re the work he did on this.

I have not played since the update which was released today and which is supposed to help towards dealing with disconnectors/AFK's. My comments may be outdated already but people disconnecting ruined games. Maybe the bots will help with that.

Other than that

reviewText:
The surroundings and sound effects and smart, tactical engagements and tense periods of paranoia make you feel like your fighting for you life for real.
Each match both sharks and divers can unlock new weapons and upgrades. These must still be purchased within each match with gold for divers or kills for sharks what ever side your on, it gives at least some sense of persistent progression. The most disappointing section of the game menu was the lack of gameplay modes.  How ever even with lack of other game modes its still Bad a$$ to play as the Shark and rip into divers. Give it a Try you will love it.

reviewText:
As you drop in into the water, you see your fellow mates drop with you. They are tense, knowing the area is chock full of man-eating sharks. As you leave the cage in the water, you see a glint in the darkness. Gold! As you swim to it, your heart starts to beat really quickly, making you uneasy, but you don't know why. Suddenly, a dark shape darts out of the darkness,  its jaws wrapped tightly around your waist. You stab at the beast, but to no avail. Your vision fades, and your corpse floats in the water, your fellow divers meeting the same fate.
Until the next respawn, anyways.
Great game, slow response times at times.
9.8/10

reviewText:
This is a game that definitely needs to be tried. Divers vs Sharks. The tension felt while playing as the divers is comparable to the excitement of hunting them down as a shark. There's nothing better than tackling an unsuspecting diver out of the room they're defending while his buddies watch on. Or using temwork to take down one of the ocean's greatest predators.
The game is pretty well balanced, but as the divers you definitely need teamwork and communication to get the edge over the sharks.
There've been numerous updates since release, with the addition of a new game-mode, new sharks, and new equipment, so the developers are certainly keen on keeping this project going from first impressions.
If you like PvP games, definitely give this one a go with a few friends.

reviewText:
Play as one of 2 sharks or 4 divers as the divers race to collect all the gold, and the sharks try to stop them.

As a shark: Bust through walls, sneak through shipwrecks. Bolt from the dark and eat a diver, thrashing your mouse to tear his greedy flesh!

As a diver: Work together to stay alive and escort an unmanned submersible as it cuts into safes and gathers Nazi gold. Seriously. Work as a team or be chow. Always buy the consumables. And don't forget, when they're trying to eat you, you can still stab them with your dive knife! Don't go down without a fight!

SOoooo worth a play, but get it on sale.

reviewText: Excellent game. Simple to learn and then great fun to master. Brilliant as both divers and sharks, a very intense atmosphere in beatiful locations. The maps are well designed and offer an amazing 3d environment to manouvre in. Excellent sound effects and I love the wildlife swimming around with you, jelly fish, seals, and even a very large octopus. Really adds to the feeling of being a long way from home deep down in the ocean. You can almost smell the sea air when it starts. Gameplay is so far well balanced, with it being close finishes a lot of the time. Not a lot of additional content (game modes, customisation etc) but it does seem to be growing. I have had a lot of fun so far with it, once you get the hang of it (there isn't much of a tutorial).

reviewText:
I absolutely love this game! My roomie kept trying to convince me to buy it so we could both play and it ended up with 6 of us buying the game. There a few things I would like to see added or touched up though!

Pros:

- Awesome co-op play
- Dark and terrifying atmosphere
- Decent amount of weapons to play with
- Watch your roomies scream as they get dragged into the darkness.

Cons:

- Flares seem lackluster and don't illuminate much, perhaps I'm not using them correctly
- A few maps have a very large open-water section at the end of the map which I've found to be almost unfair for divers
- only 6 maps atm, 10 if you count the Megalodon game type, though I don't enjoy it as much.
- Not enough pairs of underwear


I would love to see a few more maps and gametypes come in later dlc/patchs, as well as game variants with more players.

reviewText: This game feels GREAT!  As a diver, you have to collect treasure, defend your robot, and HIDE!!  The sharks will swoop you up almost instantly and it takes a headstrong group to avoid a chum fest.   Playing as the shark is unlike anything else in this genre.   Incredible speed and dirty tactics is all you need.  Each shark has different active abilities.  The great white can take extra damage while the tiger shark (My personal favorite) can become invisible for a short time.  As long as they keep the content rolling, I can find time for this gem.  I can't wait to see whats next.  The Megaladon game mode they just added is fun.  Its like tag, but the player who is it, is a GIGANTIC SHARK.  The maps are large and well made.  The graphics are stunning.  The gameplay is outstanding and smart.  Just buy it, so we can play.

reviewText:
Is Depth a great game?
I am trying to answer that question in that review
--------------------------

+ great Atmosphere
+ great gameplay
+ great graphics
+ a lot of variety
+ it runs good

--------------------------

- it takes a long time to get on a server
- the server are sometimes laggy

--------------------------

Depth is not only a good first person shooter. The visuals and the atmosphere make it way more than a simple first person shooter. The setting make it different from Different from other games out there even though the gameplay feels familiar to other games on the marked.
In the end Depth make a great mix between something really unique and something familiar.

=> 8.5/10

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead meets Jaws

The aim of the game is to collect as much tresure as you can.Before the sharks come and eat you alive. Divers can spend the loot on upgrades of equipment.

The game is quite nerve-wrecking with a sense of danger and panic from knowing the sharks are around and the music which changes to more pounding as the sharks appear.

The game allows you to play as a shark which gives you a choice at the start. However you can find yourself outnumbered by people choosing to play as divers rather than as shark-which means some games 1vs4 or 2vs 4.

One bad point about the game is that once you've choosing to play as shark-it's impossible to change type of shark that you want to be.
