reviewText:
If you have not bought this game, you have to buy it right now.
Depth is a game where a team of divers look for treasure on various maps, ranging from Ancient Aztec ruins, to WWII Battlefields, to shipwrecks.
As a diver, you must collect loose gold, shoot sharks, and protect S.T.E.V.E, the robot which opens the various safes full of treasure. You can buy new weapons to better defend yourself, and can also buy consumables, like Mines, Shark Shields, which restrict the sharks view upon entering the radius of it, Sonar Beacons & flares to help see better.
As a shark, you can play as a Tiger Shark, a Great White, or a Mako, all with various strengths & weaknesses.
Your goal is to either eat all of the divers, or destroy S.T.E.V.E. You can buy upgrades to better attack the humans with points. You can increase your speed, how much health you gain over time, various abilities, etc.
But honestly. If you like FPS's, you'll like to play as the diver. If you like to be a deadly beast, or pretty much anything, you'll like the shark.
But honestly, this game is a must have. Go buy it.
Here is the final score:
Diver Gameplay: 9/10 (They need to have an update for that DPV, I hate running out of ammo.)
Shark Gameplay: 10/10 (No seriously, I absolutely love eating things. Did you know you can eat seals for health?)
Graphics/Enviroment: 9/10 (Some parts of the map you can break through as a shark, and the place is pretty atmospherical...)
Overall Rating: 9.5/10.

reviewText:
So, Depth is about spooky sharks vs lunchboxes/divers.
Currently sporting two modes, both being quite tense, you have  the regular Escort mission, 4 divers vs 2 sharks, with a basic variation in sharks and weapons and equipent to use. The fun in this game comes from the tactics really, as a shark you really have to be careful, you die just as fast as the diver...but you ar MUCH faster ;) Wait for a diver to swim past a doorway then lunge through, turning the corner so that their friends can't shoot you, and chew them up :D

As a diver, you simply *have* to use the equipment to be effective. You won't see a good shark coming until it's almost on top of you, but with sonar and tagging systems, you can help relieve this drawback! :D

The second mode is Megladon Hunt, a team of divers against one Megladon, and the divers have to collect treasure to upgrade their guns!

Pros -
~ Very Spooky game, more atmospheric than you'd imagine
~ Hilarious fun
~ Good replayability
~ Rewarding for skilled players
~ Quite easy to find a match
~ UPGRADE SYSTEMS YAY
~ Pretty and interesting world

Cons -
~ Menus are kinda dated
~ Character models are a bit lax, but I assume that might get an update
~ Only 3 choices of shark, bit generic too. Was hoping for some cool things like having built in abilities for the sharks, for example a hammer head could ram better maybe?
~ No customization of character sadly (WE WANT HATS, WE WANT HATS, WE WANT HATS)
Seriously, every game needs microtransactions for cosmetics :D

All in all, while it's on sale I'd definitely pick it up, I think £18-19 is a bit too much but having paid £11, I'm damn happy with my purchase :D
8/10 Best diving game ever" - Davy Jones"

reviewText: Excellent game and more than worth the normal sales price. You get to play as either a shark or a diver. The objective of the divers is to work as a team of four to collect treasure from different settings on the sea floor with a robot safe picker called S.T.E.V.E. Divers move from one objective to the next on the map and have to escort S.T.E.V.E to each treasure safe until the team makes it back to the extraction point at which point the divers win. Divers are armed with different undersea weapons like harpoons, net guns, and undersea mines. The sharks come in teams of two and their goal is obviously to eat the divers before the sharks run out of lives or the diver team makes it back to the extraction point. The game requires some strategy without being too complicated; divers tend to stick together to back each other up and the sharks do best when coming up with surprise entrances to swoop in and grab a diver for dinner. Easy recommend, you won't be disappointed!

reviewText:
Depth is a great game to play whether with or without friends!

The sharks are so fun to play as and strategize with as you swim through the waters looking to get the drop on one, two, or multiple victims if you're skilled enough. However, don't be fooled! The sharks can become the hunted if played poorly.

The divers face challenging gameplay in often dark areas. You may be greedy at certain points to gather treasure away from the group, but hearing your heart beat in game faster and faster let's you know you've made a bad decision!

Both sides get the opportunity to upgrade and prepare for the next battle, too.

Overall Depth gives an awesome experience that's well worth $25.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: This game first came to my attention via word of mouth and from youtube playthroughs mostly centering around Ohmwrecker and Gassymexican. For those of you who are on the fence on buying this game, I would like to highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a unique experience.\n\nI would describe Depth as a refreshing first person shooter with a good mix of survival aspects and teamwork (which opens up the opportunity for an overall fun experience with friends). The overall premise of the game as you can already probably notice is that there are two modes, the first one being Blood and Gold" where four players play as divers who are seeking treasure in the underwater DEPTHS alongside an AI driven robot called STEVE while two other players play on an opposing geam as sharks (either Mako
recommended: and Tiger) ad the second mode being Megalodon hunt which essentially takes four divers vs a "huge" (not really huge as this was more of a design choice for easire movement) megalodon.\n\nThe movement and combat sytle for each team is great
hoursPlayed: and the mechanics of the game is well balanced with both teams having a set amoutn of 30 respawns they can burn through and sharks having specific skill perks you can purchase through your kill points
voteText: and divers having the opportunity to buy and earn better weapons through picking up treasure individually and delivering it to STEVE for the cash bonus.\nFrom shaking your mouse as a shark to tear divers apart once you grab hold of them
helpfulPercent: to replenishing health via eating seals
votesHelpful: to the game taking advantage of what can be called "Drawing distance" to add suspense and adrenaline rushes as divers try to peer out into the distance or shadows searching for the other team before they strike (sharks distance in relation to a diver's position is relayed to you the player through the speed of heartbeats) Depth has a lot of unique elements that I enjoy.\n\nCompalints are that I can see some people not enjoying the fact that this game boils down to one specific formula of asymetric play which might bore people
votesTotal: but so far with the 10 hours I've put into the game I'm still really enjoying it and consider the game a great price for what I got out of it (I bought it during its week long discount of $14.99 but would recommend it still even at $24.99). Another complaint is that for a game with the visuals that Depth has
votesFunny: it strangely can be somewhat taxing on a system
commentsCount: as I believe TotalBiscuit pointed out himself on his own rig in his WTF is...)\n\nWhat it boils down to
column16: is that if you really enjoyed L4D2 multiplayer
column17: or are greatly interested in Evolve for its unique gameplay
column18: then you'll really enjoy Depth."

I found this game extremely fun and it was quite ammusing to eat all of those divers and seals or just to shoot all those sharks with your... machine gun? Do ask me how the assualt riffle works under water... that my friend is an unsolved mystery.
I loved how when a shark is near you can hear your charecters heart beat getting faster and faster.

Oh and those sea mines are my new best friends they are so helpfull...     ...KABOOM!!!!
exept that they can also kill you... ... so I sugest you be careful with those.

But over all I think that its a great game and I reccomend it to everyone!

reviewText:
First of all, let's get something straight here: This game is a true work of creativity. I haven't been so afraid of sharks since I watched Deep Blue Sea (Jaws only had one shark, so yeah). The concept alone would probably earn it a 8/10, and anything after that is just icing on the cake.

So, let's start off with what I've been very impressed with. The visuals are absolutely stunning. While many of the decorative options will considerably slow your average computer down a good bit, they are absolutely worth it if you can handle it.

When you are playing as a shark, you have some sense of awesomeness and that you are going to wreck everybody, even if you really aren't. If I can play a character and do bad and still feel like a boss, then there's either something wrong with me or the game is really fun. This does not, by any means, make the sharks OP. They aren't. I've killed a good number of sharks in every match, so if you can't kill them, maybe you should try another strategy.

When playing as a diver, you have some sort of fear of imminent fright, much like when everything turns quiet in a horror movie. In all honesty, you feel rather helpless. However, this doesn't mean that you are defenseless.

There are a wide range of weaponry to fit many playstyles; there is a netgun, tagging pistols, a DPV to swim faster with, machine guns, and as if the machine guns weren't surprising enough, there's a harpoon gun that shoots explosive harpoons. FRAGGIN GRENADES STRAPPED TO A GOOD 'OL WHALE-O-MATIC 2000!

While I was somewhat disappointed with the narrow range of sharks, I was impressed with the abilities and playstyles they complimented. You can go squishy and speedy, sneaky, or big and tanky. Fun for the whole family (not really, I don't reccomend showing this to young persons or old persons for risk of nightmares and/or heart attacks)!

After a good bit of time playing this, I have very few quarrels with this game, and the ones I have are rather extraneous. However, they are there regardless.

One thing that I was disappointed with was the amount of resources it will take to run this smoothly. If you expect to run this game at smooth 30-60 FPS, then, well, let's just say you're going to need a bigger boat. I suppose I shouldn't be so much disappointed with the game as I should be with my computer's gaming capabilities, but I am disappointed nonetheless.

I noticed very distinct points in some maps such as Devil's Head (in the mine shaft) where S.T.E.V.E. (the robot whose protection is supposed to be the primary objective for the divers) will get stuck, constantly rammed by Makos who have invested in every speed and stamina perk. With no difference in damage dealt to S.T.E.V.E. between the different sharks, it can be very annoying.

My last complaint are the times that it will take you to find a server. My average wait time for a server is probably around a minute and a half. This may not seem so bad, but this is with no filters enabled at all except to play as diver. This means I was queued to join all of the available servers, play on any map, and on any game mode. In my experience with multiplayer games, it should not take more than a minute to find any available game. Again, this is a superficial issue that doesn't do too much to kill the gameplay.

My overall rating would have to be a 9/10. It is a phenomenal game with a phenomenal concept. If you don't have friends that have this game on their wish list, you should probably tell them about it, because believe me, they do. Is it a $25 dollar game? Maybe not. Could is use some smoothing out here and there? Just like every game can. Would I reccomend it? In half an instant.

9/10 would pee myself again IGN.

reviewText:
Depth is a great game to play whether with or without friends!

The sharks are so fun to play as and strategize with as you swim through the waters looking to get the drop on one, two, or multiple victims if you're skilled enough. However, don't be fooled! The sharks can become the hunted if played poorly.

The divers face challenging gameplay in often dark areas. You may be greedy at certain points to gather treasure away from the group, but hearing your heart beat in game faster and faster let's you know you've made a bad decision!

Both sides get the opportunity to upgrade and prepare for the next battle, too.

Overall Depth gives an awesome experience that's well worth $25.

reviewText: This game first came to my attention via word of mouth and from youtube playthroughs mostly centering around Ohmwrecker and Gassymexican. For those of you who are on the fence on buying this game, I would like to highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a unique experience.\n\nI would describe Depth as a refreshing first person shooter with a good mix of survival aspects and teamwork (which opens up the opportunity for an overall fun experience with friends). The overall premise of the game as you can already probably notice is that there are two modes, the first one being Blood and Gold" where four players play as divers who are seeking treasure in the underwater DEPTHS alongside an AI driven robot called STEVE while two other players play on an opposing geam as sharks (either Mako
recommended: and Tiger) ad the second mode being Megalodon hunt which essentially takes four divers vs a "huge" (not really huge as this was more of a design choice for easire movement) megalodon.\n\nThe movement and combat sytle for each team is great
hoursPlayed: and the mechanics of the game is well balanced with both teams having a set amoutn of 30 respawns they can burn through and sharks having specific skill perks you can purchase through your kill points
voteText: and divers having the opportunity to buy and earn better weapons through picking up treasure individually and delivering it to STEVE for the cash bonus.\nFrom shaking your mouse as a shark to tear divers apart once you grab hold of them
helpfulPercent: to replenishing health via eating seals
votesHelpful: to the game taking advantage of what can be called "Drawing distance" to add suspense and adrenaline rushes as divers try to peer out into the distance or shadows searching for the other team before they strike (sharks distance in relation to a diver's position is relayed to you the player through the speed of heartbeats) Depth has a lot of unique elements that I enjoy.\n\nCompalints are that I can see some people not enjoying the fact that this game boils down to one specific formula of asymetric play which might bore people
votesTotal: but so far with the 10 hours I've put into the game I'm still really enjoying it and consider the game a great price for what I got out of it (I bought it during its week long discount of $14.99 but would recommend it still even at $24.99). Another complaint is that for a game with the visuals that Depth has
votesFunny: it strangely can be somewhat taxing on a system
commentsCount: as I believe TotalBiscuit pointed out himself on his own rig in his WTF is...)\n\nWhat it boils down to
column16: is that if you really enjoyed L4D2 multiplayer
column17: or are greatly interested in Evolve for its unique gameplay
column18: then you'll really enjoy Depth."
column19: January 14, 2015
column20: true

reviewText: first off,it's an early access multiplayer shooter so i know what your probaly thinking.1.there are probaly tryhards and 5 year olds everywhere who who swear at you when you beat them.2.since it's early access it dosen't function properly and didn't deliver on it's promises. But that is where this game shines,insted of tryhards and squekers there is a friendly and helpful community that are very nice people whiche is a breath of fresh air from something like counter strike where it is littered with them. Also the game does deliver on promises by being fun,scary,tense,alot of fun with friends,and how polished it is,that is a recipe for a great game you can sink hours into. Here's what im gonna say if you like team based multiplayer shooters like counter strike you might like this and since it's early access they are gonna add more modes,maps,weapons,and other cool stuff that i can't wait to play,so if you see this in a sale like i did i would suggest you pick this up.

reviewText:
Fun ♥♥♥ game. Spooky ocean enviroments. Team of 4 divers vs 2 Sharks. Can pick your gear and upgrades as both species. Can play as many different Sharks. 3 Game modes. Blood and Gold sees the Divers attempting to protect a submersible opening safes, while the sharks try to kill the divers or destroy the submersible. Megalodon hunt sees 5 divers vs an ai Megaldon. Whoever kills it becomes it and racks points up by killing with it. Hide and Seek sees divers with Bang Sticks hiding from Sharks. When a diver dies, they become a shark.

This game is outstandingly fun. Matches are Decent length, but not too long or short. Maps are detailed and fun to look at and both play styles are fun and easy to learn.

Well fitting of a 24.99 price tag.
